page.paragraph: Now listen to part of a lecture on this topic in a science class.

Let's talk about two scientists whose work is very well known today. One is Darwin, who introduced the idea of natural selection, and the other is Einstein, who introduced the idea of relativity. When Darwin introduced the idea of natural selection or when Einstein introduced the idea of relativity, these ideas represented radical changes from the accepted ideas of the era in which they were presented. Although the ideas of both Darwin and Einstein were eventually accepted, and not just accepted but viewed with awe and admiration, these ideas were initially viewed with skepticism or contempt because they were so radically different from generally accepted ideas.
